CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 26, 1958, pg. 3, reads: "'I Will Continue Fighting to Prove ALL Men Are BROTHERS' - Over 1,800 Attend Paul Robeson Concert - 'Not Afraid to Be Counted' - Part of the crowd of more than 1,800 persons, who jammed into Central Baptist Church, Monday night, to hear Paul Robeson sing and show that they are 'not afraid to be counted' when it comes to deciding who they want to hear sing and where, sit enthralled at the former All-American football player and Phi Beta Kappa member who is being honored throughout the world this month on the occasion of his 60th birthday. The brilliant baritone artist, obviously happy at the response, sang with warmth, power, and almost perfect pitch and gave a masterful recitative performance of the 'Death Scene' from 'Othello.'  The valiant warrior received a standing ovation from the audience when he appeared on the rostrum. - Harris photo."
TitMainTitle: Audience seated in pews, including Rev. Cornell Talley third from left in first pew, for Paul Robeson performance, in Central Baptist Church
